title.narrative: Urban Pathways – Supporting Low Carbon Plans For Urban Basic Services In The Context Of The New Urban Agenda

description.narrative:
The overall purpose of this Programme is to achieve the UN-Habitat Sub-Programme 4 (Urban Basic Services) objective to: “To increase equitable access to urban basic services and improve the standard of living of the urban poor”. The objectives contributing to this project are:
Informing targeted audience of local, national and international decision makers, experts and civil society organisations about the climate change mitigation and sustainable development potential of urban basic services measures and share experiences about the implementation process in the pilot countries; Inspire experts, officials and practitioners with a dedicated Change Maker capacity building programme. Urban Pathways will work with 10 cities on action plans and specific policy proposal development that initiate implementation, which can be replicated regionally and contribute to the global implementation process of the New Urban Agenda;Implement pilot action concepts that lead to the implementation of integrated pilot projects in at least three cities and will form the basis for four national low-carbon urban implementation action plans. All of the project's outputs will contribute to an international knowledge sharing and tracking of progress on the implementation of the New Urban Agenda, and the Sustainable Development Goals and Paris Agreement on the local level.

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Low-carbon cities implementation facility launched by 8/2018. Guidelines, factsheets and policy papers published starting from 12/2017 on a regular basis (annually). Urban implementation action tracker launched on the website by 8/2018. Publication of project results by 10/2020. Present project’s key activities and results in major events and conferences starting by 01/2018
